intro: Ludwigia adscendens subsp. diffusa, commonly known as the floating heart, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that float on the water surface. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that are typically borne on short stalks above the water. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments and is often found in ponds and marshes. Ludwigia adscendens subsp. diffusa is popular in aquatic gardens for its ornamental value and ability to provide habitat for aquatic life.
